prompt: <description>**Instructions to Create the Final Shape** The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. **Part 1: Creating the First Intermediate CAD Part** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered in the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a Translation Vector of [0.0, 0.1701, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw four lines to create a rectangle. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3634, 0.0]; Line 2: Start Point [0.3634, 0.0], End Point [0.3634, 0.75]; Line 3: Start Point [0.3634, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75]; Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0]. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1701 units to create the 3D model. **Part 2: Creating the Second Intermediate CAD Part** Create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism on top of it. The larger prism is positioned at an angle to the smaller one. 1. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and a Translation Vector of [0.0619, 0.1044, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw two rectangles side by side to create a larger rectangle. Rectangle 1: Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0928, 0.0]; Line 2: Start Point [0.0928, 0.0], End Point [0.0928, 0.0387]; Line 3: Start Point [0.0928, 0.0387], End Point [0.0, 0.0387]; Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0387], End Point [0.0, 0.0]. Rectangle 2: Line 1: Start Point [0.1469, 0.0], End Point [0.2397, 0.0]; Line 2: Start Point [0.2397, 0.0], End Point [0.2397, 0.0387]; Line 3: Start Point [0.2397, 0.0387], End Point [0.1469, 0.0387]; Line 4: Start Point [0.1469, 0.0387], End Point [0.1469, 0.0]. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2397. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.1082 units to create the 3D model. Note: The boolean operation between the two parts is a CutFeatureOperation.</description>
